paper_abstract: Consider a tensor product H = H-1 circle times H-2 circle times (center dot center dot center dot) circle times H-k of finite-dimensional Hilbert spaces with dimension H-i = d(i), 1 <= i <= k. Then the maximum dimension possible for a subspace of H with no non-zero product vector is known to be d(1)d(2)center dot center dot center dot d(k) - (d(1) + d(2) + center dot center dot center dot + d(k)) + k - 1. We obtain an explicit example of a subspace of this kind. We determine the set of product vectors in its orthogonal complement and show that it has the minimum dimension possible for an unextendible product basis of not necessarily orthogonal product vectors.
paper_title: A completely entangled subspace of maximal dimension
